vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/91a9742b-2b19-4201-bd96-8b2f39e73738">WORKPLACE</keyword>         <topcClas>Information technology - Media, communication and language</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Time use - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Home Online, 1998-2001</i> (HoL) data derive from a household panel survey conducted over three annual waves. The main focus of the research was to gather household and individual information and examine information and communications technology (ICT) access and behaviour.<br> <br> Methodology from the HoL dataset was also used for a later <i>British Household Panel Survey</i> (BHPS) (held at the UK Data Archive (UKDA) under GN 33196) derived dataset, <i>British Household Panel Survey Calibrated Time Use Data, 1994-2004</i>, (held under SN 5363). <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Most of the non-ICT questions were derived from the BHPS, and covered topics such as housing, social life, leisure time activities, computer use, employment, telephone use, internet use and demographic characteristics. Respondents also completed a time-budget diary covering one week.<br> <br> Standard Measures<br> Hope-Goldthorpe Scale; various Likert scales; Market Research Society social class.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="1998-01-01T00:00:00Z">1998</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2000-01-01T00:00:00Z">2001</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Standard Statistical Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>All individuals aged 16 years and above in the households sampled, resident in Great Britain during 1998-2001. Children aged 9-15 in the households also completed diaries.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Longitudinal/panel/cohort</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>the survey included three waves.</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>NOP Research Group</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <sampProc>included oversampling of households in Wave 1 with computers.</sampProc>         <deviat>Weights were used to adjust for non-response and over-sampling.</deviat>         <deviat>1753 (target)   999 (obtained)   Households in Wave 1</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Telephone interview; Diaries</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No information recorded</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. See <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx>terms and conditions of access</a> for further information.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>5363 British Household Panel Survey Calibrated Time Use Data, 1994-2004 </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>Birke, D. and Swann, G. M. P. (2006) 'Network effects and the choice of mobile phone operator', <i>Journal of Evolutionary Economics</i>, 16(1-2), pp.65-84.<br></relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
